channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Ingram Micro Breach Exposes Data of 42,000 After Safepay Ransomware Attack
item.description:
Headline: Ingram Micro Breach Exposes Data of 42,000 After Safepay Ransomware Attack

Summary:
Global IT distributor Ingram Micro has officially notified 42,521 individuals that their personal and sensitive information, including Social Security numbers, was stolen during a ransomware attack in July 2025. The incident, attributed to the Safepay ransomware group, compromised employment and job applicant records. After Ingram Micro reportedly refused to pay the ransom, the threat actors published the stolen 3.5 terabytes of data on their dark web leak site.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Global IT distributor Ingram Micro discloses that a ransomware attack in July 2025, attributed to the Safepay group, resulted in the theft of personal data, including Social Security numbers, for over 42,000 individuals.

Article Slug: ingram-micro-discloses-ransomware-attack-impacting-42000-individuals

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK NCSC Sounds Alarm on Pro-Russia Hacktivist DDoS Attacks Targeting CNI
item.description:
Headline: UK NCSC Sounds Alarm on Pro-Russia Hacktivist DDoS Attacks Targeting CNI

Summary:
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has issued a formal alert warning of persistent and disruptive denial-of-service (DoS) attacks from Russian-aligned hacktivist groups. The ideologically motivated attacks are primarily targeting UK local government and critical national infrastructure (CNI), including operational technology (OT) systems. The NCSC named the group NoName057(16) as particularly active and urged organizations to bolster their defenses.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) warns of ongoing DDoS attacks by pro-Russia hacktivist groups targeting UK critical infrastructure and government services, urging organizations to strengthen their defenses.

Article Slug: uk-ncsc-warns-of-persistent-pro-russia-hacktivist-ddos-attacks

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CEOs Optimistic, CISOs Wary: Survey Reveals Deep Divide on AI's Cybersecurity Impact
item.description:
Headline: CEOs Optimistic, CISOs Wary: Survey Reveals Deep Divide on AI's Cybersecurity Impact

Summary:
A new survey by specialty insurer AXIS Capital, released on January 20, 2026, reveals a significant perception gap between CEOs and CISOs regarding the role of artificial intelligence in cybersecurity. While CEOs are largely optimistic about AI's productivity and security benefits, CISOs are more acutely aware of the new risks it introduces, including data leakage, model manipulation, and sophisticated AI-driven attacks. This disconnect could lead to misaligned security strategies and underinvestment in critical risk areas.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Security Operations, Other

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A new survey from AXIS Capital highlights a growing divide between CEOs and CISOs on the cybersecurity implications of AI, with CISOs expressing greater concern over emerging risks.

Article Slug: ceos-cisos-split-on-ai-cybersecurity-risks-rewards-survey-finds

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: North Korean 'Konni' APT Weaponizes Google Ads to Deliver EndRAT Malware
item.description:
Headline: North Korean 'Konni' APT Weaponizes Google Ads to Deliver EndRAT Malware

Summary:
The North Korean state-sponsored threat group Konni is conducting a sophisticated spear-phishing campaign dubbed "Operation Poseidon." The advanced persistent threat (APT) actor is weaponizing Google advertising URLs to make malicious links appear legitimate, thereby bypassing security filters and tricking users. The campaign's ultimate goal is to deliver the 'EndRAT' malware, a remote access trojan, onto victim systems.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The North Korean APT group Konni is abusing Google's advertising platform in a campaign dubbed "Operation Poseidon" to deliver the EndRAT malware, using sophisticated evasion techniques.

Article Slug: north-korean-apt-konni-abuses-google-ads-in-operation-poseidon

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 'Evelyn Stealer' Malware Targets Developers in Malicious VS Code Extensions
item.description:
Headline: 'Evelyn Stealer' Malware Targets Developers in Malicious VS Code Extensions

Summary:
A sophisticated, multi-stage malware campaign is deploying the 'Evelyn' information stealer by hiding it within malicious Visual Studio Code (VSC) extensions. First analyzed by Trend Micro, the malware specifically targets software developers to exfiltrate a wide range of sensitive data, including browser credentials, system information, clipboard data, and cryptocurrency wallets. The campaign highlights the growing risk of supply chain attacks originating from compromised developer environments.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The 'Evelyn' information stealer is targeting software developers by hiding in malicious Visual Studio Code extensions to steal credentials, crypto wallets, and sensitive data.

Article Slug: evelyn-stealer-malware-targets-developers-via-vs-code-extensions

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Stealthy 'PDFSIDER' Backdoor Uses DLL Side-Loading to Bypass EDR and AV
item.description:
Headline: Stealthy 'PDFSIDER' Backdoor Uses DLL Side-Loading to Bypass EDR and AV

Summary:
Security researchers at Resecurity have uncovered a new stealthy backdoor, dubbed 'PDFSIDER,' that uses a DLL side-loading technique to evade EDR and antivirus solutions. The malware masquerades as a legitimate PDF application to load a malicious DLL, establishing an encrypted command-and-control channel for long-term, covert access. The backdoor is already being actively used by ransomware groups, including the notorious Qilin gang, for payload delivery.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers have uncovered 'PDFSIDER', a new stealthy backdoor that uses DLL side-loading with a legitimate PDF application to evade EDR and AV defenses and establish persistent access.

Article Slug: pdfsider-backdoor-uses-dll-side-loading-to-evade-defenses

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: South Korean Giant Kyowon Group Hit by Ransomware, 9.6 Million Accounts at Risk
item.description:
Headline: South Korean Giant Kyowon Group Hit by Ransomware, 9.6 Million Accounts at Risk

Summary:
The South Korean conglomerate Kyowon Group has confirmed it suffered a significant ransomware attack that disrupted operations and resulted in data exfiltration. The attack, detected on January 10, 2026, compromised approximately 600 of the company's 800 servers. South Korean authorities estimate that up to 9.6 million user accounts (representing 5.5 million unique individuals) may have been affected, as attackers reportedly exploited an open external port to gain initial access.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: South Korean conglomerate Kyowon Group has confirmed a major ransomware attack and data theft incident that compromised 600 servers and may affect up to 9.6 million user accounts.

Article Slug: south-korean-conglomerate-kyowon-hit-by-major-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cyberattack Forces Belgian Hospital to Shut Down, Cancel Surgeries, and Transfer Patients
item.description:
Headline: Cyberattack Forces Belgian Hospital to Shut Down, Cancel Surgeries, and Transfer Patients

Summary:
A severe cyberattack on the AZ Monica hospital network in Belgium has forced a complete IT shutdown across its two campuses in Deurne and Antwerp. The incident led to the cancellation of all scheduled surgeries, the suspension of most treatments, and the emergency transfer of seven critical care patients to other facilities. The hospital's emergency department is operating at a reduced capacity, and an investigation by the Federal Police's Computer Crime Unit is underway.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A major cyberattack, suspected to be ransomware, has crippled the AZ Monica hospital in Belgium, forcing a complete IT shutdown, cancellation of surgeries, and the transfer of critical care patients.

Article Slug: cyberattack-on-belgian-hospital-forces-shutdown-patient-transfers

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fake Ad Blocker Crashes Chrome, Tricks Users into Installing 'ModeloRAT' Malware
item.description:
Headline: Fake Ad Blocker Crashes Chrome, Tricks Users into Installing 'ModeloRAT' Malware

Summary:
A novel malware campaign dubbed "CrashFix" is using a malicious Google Chrome extension that impersonates the 'uBlock Origin Lite' ad blocker to intentionally crash victims' browsers. The attack, attributed to a group called 'KongTuke,' then uses social engineering, presenting a fake crash report that tricks users into running a PowerShell command to "fix" the issue. This command ultimately downloads and installs 'ModeloRAT,' a previously undocumented Python-based remote access trojan.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A new malware campaign called 'CrashFix' uses a malicious Chrome extension to crash the browser and then tricks the user into running a PowerShell command, installing the ModeloRAT trojan.

Article Slug: crashfix-campaign-uses-fake-ad-blocker-to-crash-browsers-and-push-malware

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: GTMaritime Launches 'GT Identify' to Tackle Maritime Cybersecurity and Compliance
item.description:
Headline: GTMaritime Launches 'GT Identify' to Tackle Maritime Cybersecurity and Compliance

Summary:
Maritime technology firm GTMaritime has launched GT Identify, a new cybersecurity system designed to help ship operators comply with increasingly stringent regulations. Announced on January 20, 2026, the system provides fleet-wide hardware and software asset inventory, vulnerability reporting, and aligns with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework. The launch addresses the growing need for robust cyber risk management to meet IMO and IACS E26/E27 requirements.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 3 minutes

Meta Description: GTMaritime has launched GT Identify, a new cybersecurity system to provide maritime operators with fleet-wide asset inventory and vulnerability management to comply with IMO and IACS regulations.

Article Slug: gtmaritime-launches-gt-identify-to-bolster-maritime-cybersecurity-compliance

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Threat Landscape Converges as Attackers Target ICS and AI Systems
item.description:
Headline: Threat Landscape Converges as Attackers Target ICS and AI Systems

Summary:
New research from Cyble highlights a dangerous convergence of threats, as both hacktivists and financially motivated cybercriminals are increasingly targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Operational Technology (OT), and enterprise AI systems. The report, published January 20, 2026, notes that attackers are exploiting exposed HMI and SCADA systems while also leveraging AI to create polymorphic malware and more effective social engineering lures.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Research from Cyble reveals a growing trend of hacktivists and cybercriminals targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS) and enterprise AI, using AI to enhance attack complexity and effectiveness.

Article Slug: hacktivists-and-cybercriminals-expand-attacks-on-ics-and-ai-systems

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: 'DragonForce' Emerges as New Ransomware Cartel Built on LockBit and Conti DNA
item.description:
Headline: 'DragonForce' Emerges as New Ransomware Cartel Built on LockBit and Conti DNA

Summary:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named DragonForce has emerged, positioning itself as a "ransomware cartel." The group is reportedly building its operations on the leaked source code of the notorious LockBit 3.0 and Conti ransomware variants. Operating a RaaS platform called 'Ransombay,' DragonForce's strategy includes absorbing smaller rival operations, signaling a trend towards consolidation in the cybercrime ecosystem.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) group called DragonForce has emerged, described as a 'ransomware cartel' using leaked source code from LockBit 3.0 and Conti.

Article Slug: dragonforce-emerges-as-new-ransomware-cartel-using-lockbit-and-conti-code

Published Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 20 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Weaponized Invites: Google Gemini Flaw Allows Calendar Data Theft via Prompt Injection
item.description:
Headline: Weaponized Invites: Google Gemini Flaw Allows Calendar Data Theft via Prompt Injection

Summary:
Security researchers from Miggo Security have uncovered a significant vulnerability in Google Gemini's integration with Google Calendar. The flaw allowed attackers to use an indirect prompt injection technique to exfiltrate summaries of private meetings. By sending a specially crafted calendar invitation containing a hidden malicious prompt, an attacker could trick the AI into executing unauthorized actions when the user made a legitimate query about their calendar. This attack bypassed Google's privacy controls without requiring the user to interact directly with the malicious payload, highlighting emerging security risks in applications integrated with large language models (LLMs).

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Google Gemini vulnerability, prompt injection, LLM security, Google Calendar data theft, AI security flaw, Miggo Security, indirect prompt injection

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A significant prompt injection vulnerability in Google Gemini allowed attackers to craft malicious calendar invites to steal private meeting summaries, bypassing security controls.

Article Slug: google-gemini-prompt-injection-flaw-exposes-private-calendar-data

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Evelyn Stealer: New Malware Hits Developers Through Malicious VS Code Extensions
item.description:
Headline: Evelyn Stealer: New Malware Hits Developers Through Malicious VS Code Extensions

Summary:
A new information-stealing malware, named Evelyn Stealer, is being distributed through malicious extensions on the Microsoft Visual Studio Code (VS Code) Marketplace. Researchers at Trend Micro and Koi Security report the campaign specifically targets software developers to steal credentials, cryptocurrency wallet data, and other sensitive information. Three malicious extensions—`BigBlack.bitcoin-black`, `BigBlack.codo-ai`, and `BigBlack.mrbigblacktheme`—have been identified as the distribution vectors. This supply chain attack highlights the significant risk posed by unvetted third-party tools in development environments, as compromising a single developer can provide a gateway into an entire organization's critical infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Evelyn Stealer, VS Code malware, developer security, supply chain attack, information stealer, Trend Micro, malicious extensions

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new malware campaign, Evelyn Stealer, is targeting software developers by distributing an info-stealer through malicious Microsoft Visual Studio Code extensions.

Article Slug: evelyn-stealer-malware-targets-developers-via-malicious-vs-code-extensions

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Patch Now: Critical Flaw Exposes Thousands of TP-Link VIGI Cameras to Remote Hacking
item.description:
Headline: Patch Now: Critical Flaw Exposes Thousands of TP-Link VIGI Cameras to Remote Hacking

Summary:
TP-Link has issued urgent firmware updates for a critical vulnerability in its VIGI line of security cameras. The flaw could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the devices, potentially viewing, modifying, or deleting surveillance footage. At the time of disclosure, researchers discovered over 2,500 VIGI cameras were exposed to the public internet and vulnerable to this attack. Owners are strongly advised to update their camera firmware immediately and ensure their devices are not directly accessible from the internet to mitigate the significant risk of compromise.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Patch Management

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: TP-Link VIGI vulnerability, remote hacking, IoT security camera flaw, firmware update, critical vulnerability, internet-exposed devices

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: TP-Link has patched a critical remote hacking vulnerability in its VIGI security cameras. With over 2,500 devices found exposed online, users must update firmware immediately.

Article Slug: critical-vulnerability-in-tp-link-vigi-cameras-allows-remote-hacking

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 16.6 Million Records Exposed: Raaga and Pass'Sport Breaches Added to Have I Been Pwned
item.description:
Headline: 16.6 Million Records Exposed: Raaga and Pass'Sport Breaches Added to Have I Been Pwned

Summary:
The Have I Been Pwned (HIBP) data breach notification service has been updated with over 16.6 million user records from two separate incidents. The first breach involves 10.2 million users of the Indian music streaming service Raaga, which occurred in December 2025 and exposed names, email addresses, and MD5-hashed passwords. The second breach affects 6.4 million users of the French government's Pass'Sport program, also from December 2025, exposing names, dates of birth, and email addresses. Users of these services are urged to check HIBP and change their passwords, especially for the Raaga breach, due to the high risk of credential stuffing attacks from the weakly hashed passwords.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Have I Been Pwned, Raaga data breach, Pass'Sport data breach, HIBP update, credential stuffing, MD5 password hash, data breach notification

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Have I Been Pwned has added 16.6 million records from data breaches at Indian music service Raaga and the French government's Pass'Sport program, exposing PII and passwords.

Article Slug: raaga-pass-sport-breaches-added-to-have-i-been-pwned-16m-records

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ScarCruft APT: North Korean Hackers Evolve Tactics in 'Artemis' Campaign
item.description:
Headline: ScarCruft APT: North Korean Hackers Evolve Tactics in 'Artemis' Campaign

Summary:
The North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) group ScarCruft, also known as APT37 or Reaper, has launched a new campaign dubbed 'Artemis'. Active since late 2025, the campaign targets entities likely in South Korea using malicious Hanword Word Processor (HWP) documents. Researchers report that ScarCruft has evolved its tactics, now employing steganography to hide malicious code within image files and leveraging legitimate cloud services, specifically Yandex Cloud, for its command and control (C2) infrastructure. This shift makes the group's activities harder to detect, as their C2 traffic blends in with legitimate cloud service activity.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: ScarCruft, APT37, North Korea APT, Artemis campaign, steganography, Yandex Cloud C2, HWP malware

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The North Korean APT group ScarCruft (APT37) has launched a new 'Artemis' campaign using evolved tactics like steganography and Yandex Cloud for C2 infrastructure.

Article Slug: north-korean-apt-scarcruft-evolves-tactics-in-artemis-campaign

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cloud Breaches Skyrocket, Now Costing Firms an Average of $5.1 Million
item.description:
Headline: Cloud Breaches Skyrocket, Now Costing Firms an Average of $5.1 Million

Summary:
Recent reports analyzing the 2025-2026 threat landscape reveal a significant and sustained increase in attacks against cloud infrastructure. Cloud-targeted attacks rose 21% year-over-year, with 81% of organizations experiencing at least one cloud security incident. The primary causes are not sophisticated exploits but fundamental security lapses: credential compromise was the top attack vector, followed closely by cloud misconfigurations and insecure APIs. The financial consequences are severe, with the average cost of a cloud data breach climbing to an estimated $5.1 million in 2026, highlighting an urgent need for improved cloud security posture management.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: cloud security statistics 2026, cost of cloud data breach, cloud attack trends, credential compromise, cloud misconfiguration, API security, CSPM

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Cloud security incidents are on the rise, increasing 21% year-over-year, with the average breach cost now at $5.1 million, driven by credential compromise and misconfigurations.

Article Slug: cloud-security-incidents-surge-costing-firms-over-5-million-per-breach

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Manhunt: Black Basta Ransomware Leader Added to EU's Most Wanted List After Raids
item.description:
Headline: Manhunt: Black Basta Ransomware Leader Added to EU's Most Wanted List After Raids

Summary:
An international law enforcement operation has targeted the prolific Black Basta ransomware group, which is linked to over 600 attacks and millions in ransom payments. Police in Ukraine conducted raids against two suspected members of the syndicate. Concurrently, an international arrest warrant and an INTERPOL Red Notice have been issued for a Russian national believed to be the group's founder and leader. The individual has been placed on the EU's Most Wanted list, signaling a high-priority, coordinated effort to dismantle one of the world's most active ransomware operations.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Black Basta ransomware, EU Most Wanted, INTERPOL Red Notice, ransomware leader, cybercrime takedown, international law enforcement

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: An international law enforcement operation has targeted the Black Basta ransomware group, issuing an arrest warrant for its leader and conducting raids against members in Ukraine.

Article Slug: leader-of-black-basta-ransomware-on-eu-most-wanted-list

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Public Exploits Released for Critical SQLi and RCE Flaws in Business Software
item.description:
Headline: Public Exploits Released for Critical SQLi and RCE Flaws in Business Software

Summary:
Multiple critical and high-severity vulnerabilities have been disclosed in various business software products, with proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits made public, elevating the risk of immediate attack. A critical SQL injection flaw (CVE-2026-1179) affects Yonyou KSOA 9.0. A critical command injection vulnerability (CVE-2026-1192) was found in Tosei Online Store Management System 1.01. Additionally, a high-severity improper authorization bug (CVE-2026-1193) impacts MineAdmin. Since vendors reportedly did not respond before disclosure, users of these products are urged to apply immediate mitigations to prevent compromise.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: CVE-2026-1179, CVE-2026-1192, CVE-2026-1193, Yonyou KSOA vulnerability, Tosei RCE, MineAdmin authorization flaw, public exploit

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Public exploits have been released for critical SQL injection (CVE-2026-1179) and command injection (CVE-2026-1192) vulnerabilities in business software, requiring immediate mitigation.

Article Slug: critical-sql-injection-and-authorization-flaws-disclosed-with-public-exploits

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Access Broker Pleads Guilty After Selling Access to 50 Companies to Undercover FBI Agent
item.description:
Headline: Access Broker Pleads Guilty After Selling Access to 50 Companies to Undercover FBI Agent

Summary:
A Jordanian national has pleaded guilty in a U.S. court for his role as an Initial Access Broker (IAB) in the cybercrime ecosystem. The man admitted to compromising and selling unauthorized access to the corporate networks of approximately 50 different enterprise organizations. The operation was uncovered when he unknowingly sold this access to an undercover U.S. federal agent. The case highlights the critical role IABs play in the cybercrime supply chain, providing the initial foothold for major threat actors like ransomware groups, and demonstrates the effectiveness of law enforcement sting operations in disrupting these criminal enterprises.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: initial access broker, IAB, FBI sting operation, cybercrime ecosystem, selling network access, ransomware supply chain

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A Jordanian national, acting as an initial access broker, has pleaded guilty in the U.S. after selling unauthorized access to 50 corporate networks to an undercover federal agent.

Article Slug: jordanian-access-broker-pleads-guilty-to-selling-network-access

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Report: Ransomware Attacks Soared 52%, Supply Chain Attacks Nearly Doubled in 2025
item.description:
Headline: Report: Ransomware Attacks Soared 52%, Supply Chain Attacks Nearly Doubled in 2025

Summary:
A new report from Cyble analyzing the 2025 cyber threat landscape reveals a record-breaking year for both ransomware and supply chain attacks. Ransomware incidents surged by 52%, with 6,604 attacks documented, while supply chain attacks saw a massive 93% increase to 297 events. The report highlights a dangerous convergence of these threats, with ransomware groups now perpetrating over half of all supply chain attacks by compromising a single software vendor to deploy ransomware to all its customers. The Qilin ransomware group was the most active player for the year, underscoring the persistent and evolving nature of these high-impact threats heading into 2026.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: ransomware statistics 2025, supply chain attack statistics, Cyble report, Qilin ransomware, LockBit, cyber threat landscape

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A 2025 threat landscape report from Cyble reveals record-breaking increases in cybercrime, with ransomware attacks up 52% and supply chain attacks up 93% year-over-year.

Article Slug: ransomware-and-supply-chain-attacks-reached-record-levels-in-2025

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Warning: Malicious Chrome Extensions Hijack Workday, NetSuite Sessions to Bypass MFA
item.description:
Headline: Warning: Malicious Chrome Extensions Hijack Workday, NetSuite Sessions to Bypass MFA

Summary:
Security researchers have uncovered five malicious Google Chrome extensions that impersonate legitimate add-ons for popular enterprise SaaS applications like Workday and NetSuite. The extensions are designed to perform session hijacking by stealing active session cookies and tokens after a user logs in. This technique allows attackers to completely bypass security controls, including multi-factor authentication (MFA), and gain full, authenticated access to the user's account. The stolen sessions can be used to exfiltrate sensitive corporate data, such as financial records and employee PII, highlighting the significant threat posed by unvetted browser extensions in corporate environments.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Data Breach, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

item.title: NEW: Healthcare Data Breaches Double, Fueled by 'Shadow AI' and Vendor Risk
item.description:
Headline: Healthcare Data Breaches Double, Fueled by 'Shadow AI' and Vendor Risk

Summary:
The healthcare industry is facing a cybersecurity crisis, with a new report indicating that the number of data breaches doubled in the past year. The surge is being driven by two key factors: the unmanaged use of generative AI tools by staff, termed 'shadow AI,' and persistent, unmitigated risks from third-party vendors. This dangerous trend is exemplified by the McLaren data breach, where a ransomware attack compromised the sensitive health information of over 743,000 patients. The report highlights a lack of confidence within the sector to handle these evolving threats, urging organizations to gain visibility into AI usage and implement far more stringent vendor risk management programs.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: healthcare data breach, shadow AI, third-party vendor risk, McLaren data breach, healthcare cybersecurity, HIPAA, ransomware

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: A new report shows healthcare data breaches have doubled, driven by risks from 'shadow AI' and third-party vendors, as exemplified by the massive McLaren patient data breach.

Article Slug: healthcare-breaches-double-amid-shadow-ai-and-vendor-risk

Published Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Ransomware Attacks Skyrocket 58% in 2025, Setting New Records
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Attacks Skyrocket 58% in 2025, Setting New Records

Summary:
Multiple cybersecurity reports released in January 2026 confirm that 2025 was the most active year for ransomware on record. A report from GuidePoint Security's GRIT team documented a staggering 58% year-over-year increase in publicly claimed ransomware victims. December 2025 alone saw 814 attacks, the highest monthly total ever recorded. Despite law enforcement takedowns of major players like LockBit, the ransomware ecosystem proved resilient. Affiliates quickly migrated to other operations, with the Qilin and Akira ransomware groups emerging as the dominant forces, collectively responsible for a significant portion of all attacks. The United States remained the primary target, and the manufacturing sector was the most heavily impacted industry.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: Cybersecurity reports from GuidePoint and Symantec show 2025 was a record year for ransomware, with a 58% increase in attacks and the rise of new dominant groups like Qilin and Akira.

Article Slug: threat-reports-detail-record-breaking-ransomware-activity-in-2025

Published Date: Fri, 16 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 16 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 19 Jan 2026 12:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: 2025 in Review: Simple Errors, Not 0-Days, Caused Biggest Breaches
item.description:
Headline: 2025 in Review: Simple Errors, Not 0-Days, Caused Biggest Breaches

Summary:
A year-end analysis of 2025's major data breaches reveals a recurring theme: fundamental security failures, not sophisticated zero-day exploits, were the primary cause. The report, published on December 26, 2025, highlights cloud security misconfigurations and third-party supply chain attacks as the dominant root causes. High-profile incidents at McDonald's (default password '123456'), TalentHook (public Azure Blob storage), Harrods, and TransUnion (both breached via third-party vendors) serve as stark examples of how neglecting basic security hygiene leads to massive data exposure.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A 2025 year-in-review report highlights that cloud misconfigurations and third-party supply chain attacks were the root cause of the year's most significant data breaches.

Article Slug: 2025-data-breaches-driven-by-misconfigurations-and-supply-chain-attacks
